005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.type;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.ICollectionValue;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.type.impl.SequenceTypeImpl;
010
011import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
012
013/**
014 * Supports
015 * <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-31/#id-sequencetype-syntax">sequence
016 * type</a> testing.
017 */
018public interface ISequenceType {
019  /**
020   * A sequence type representing an empty sequence.
021   *
022   * @return the sequence type
023   */
024  @NonNull
025  static ISequenceType empty() {
026    return SequenceTypeImpl.empty();
027  }
028
029  /**
030   * Create new sequence type using the provide type and occurrence.
031   *
032   * @param type
033   *          the required sequence item type
034   * @param occurrence
035   *          the expected occurrence of the sequence
036   * @return the new sequence type
037   */
038  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortMethodName")
039  @NonNull
040  static ISequenceType of(
041      @NonNull IItemType type,
042      @NonNull Occurrence occurrence) {
043    return Occurrence.ZERO.equals(occurrence)
044        ? empty()
045        : new SequenceTypeImpl(type, occurrence);
046  }
047
048  /**
049   * Determine if the sequence is empty (if it holds any data) or not.
050   *
051   * @return {@code true} if the sequence is empty or {@code false} otherwise
052   */
053  boolean isEmpty();
054
055  /**
056   * Get the type of the sequence.
057   *
058   * @return the type of the sequence or {@code null} if the sequence is empty
059   */
060  @NonNull
061  IItemType getType();
062
063  /**
064   * Get the occurrence of the sequence.
065   *
066   * @return the occurrence of the sequence or {@code Occurrence#ZERO} if the
067   *         sequence is empty
068   */
069  @NonNull
070  Occurrence getOccurrence();
071
072  /**
073   * Get the signature of the function as a string.
074   *
075   * @return the signature
076   */
077  @NonNull
078  String toSignature();
079
080  /**
081   * Tests that a given collection value matches this sequence type.
082   *
083   * @param value
084   *          the collection value to test
085   * @return {@code true} if the value matches the expectations of this sequence
086   *         type or {@code false} otherwise
087   */
088  boolean matches(@NonNull ICollectionValue value);
089}
